title: Any sufficiently advanced uninstaller is indistinguishable from malware
dot: digraph UninstallerVsMalware{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];A[label="Main Idea: Any sufficiently advanced uninstaller is indistinguishable from malware" shape=ellipse style=filled fillcolor=lightblue];B[label="Crash Analysis" shape=box];C[label="Execution from Stack" shape=box];D[label="Malware Behavior" shape=box];E[label="Uninstaller Behavior" shape=box];F[label="Self-Deleting Mechanism" shape=box];G[label="Code Injection Issues" shape=box];A->B;A->C;B->D[label="Similarities"];B->E[label="Differences"];C->D;C->E;E->F[label="Uses techniques that may resemble malware"];E->G[label="Potential for crashes due to code injection"]; H[label="Conclusion: Not all uninstallers are malware, but their behavior can lead to confusion." shape=note style=dashed];A->H;}

title: Credit card debt collection
dot:
digraph G{rankdir=TB;nodesep=0.5;ranksep=1;node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Arial"];edge[fontname="Arial"];subgraph cluster_0{label="Industry Waste Streams";style=filled;color=lightgray;waste[label="Waste Byproducts

(Calls, Letters)"];litigation[label="Litigation
